intro: Dimacria spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaved dimacria, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers, which range in color from purple to red, are adapted for pollination by birds and insects. Dimacria spathulata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
